clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of Continuous and Non-invasive Hemoglobin Monitoring
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Continuous and Non-invasive Hemoglobin Monitoring During Laparoscopic Gastrectomy: Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this observational study is to investigate the accuracy on the continuous and non-invasive hemoglobin monitoring during laparoscopic gastrectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: difference between SpHb value in g/dL and SaHb value in g/dL (SpHb - SaHb)
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of anesthesia to the end of anesthesia, an average 2 hours
primary_outcome.description: SpHb value in g/dL is measured by co-oxymetry, and SaHb value in g/dL is measured by blood sampling.

arm_group.description: Group receive the continuous and noninvasive hemoglobin monitoring during laparoscopic gastrectomy.

intervention.description: Subjects receive the continuous and noninvasive hemoglobin monitoring (SpHb monitoring).

study_pop.textblock: The patients were scheduled for laparoscopic gastrectomy and recieved the SpHb monitoring during surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- laparoscopic gastrectomy under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- atypical hemoglobin disease, infective state, cardiovascular disease, peripheral vascular disease
